author: nmbradford
body:
Steps to reproduce
------------------
Run invoke-webrequest against an web service that returns no content and no Content-Type in the response header.


Expected behavior
-----------------

As occurs on PowerShell full on Windows. (Both expected and actual run against the same server)
```
PS > $response = Invoke-WebRequest -Method Delete -Uri $fuluri -Headers $headerDictionary 

PS > $response                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                         StatusCode        : 200                                                                                                                         
StatusDescription : OK
Content           : {}
RawContent        : HTTP/1.1 200 OK
                    Cache-Control: no-cache, private
                    Server: 
                    Set-Cookie: JSESSIONID=67737BB04D918D29A956676E867E9983; Path=/; Secure; HttpOnly
                    Date: Fri, 11 Nov 2016 04:52:18 GMT
                    
                    
Headers           : {[Cache-Control, System.String[]], [Server, System.String[]], [Set-Cookie, System.String[]], [Date, System.String[]]}
RawContentLength  : 0
```

Actual behavior
---------------

```
PS > Invoke-WebRequest -Method Delete -Uri $fuluri -Headers $headerDictionary -SkipCertificateCheck                                                                                                                                                                     Invoke-WebRequest : Object reference not set to an instance of an object.                                                                                                                                                                                                                        
At line:1 char:1
+ Invoke-WebRequest -Method Delete -Uri $fuluri -Headers $headerDiction ...
+ ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
    + CategoryInfo          : NotSpecified: (:) [Invoke-WebRequest], NullReferenceException
    + FullyQualifiedErrorId : System.NullReferenceException,Microsoft.PowerShell.Commands.InvokeWebRequestCommand

PS /home/nick/git/PowerShell> $error[0].exception.tostring()                                                                                                                                                                                                                                     
System.NullReferenceException: Object reference not set to an instance of an object.
   at Microsoft.PowerShell.Commands.ContentHelper.GetContentType(HttpResponseMessage response) in /home/nick/git/PowerShell/src/Microsoft.PowerShell.Commands.Utility/commands/utility/WebCmdlet/CoreCLR/ContentHelper.CoreClr.cs:line 23
   at Microsoft.PowerShell.Commands.WebRequestPSCmdlet.ProcessRecord() in /home/nick/git/PowerShell/src/Microsoft.PowerShell.Commands.Utility/commands/utility/WebCmdlet/CoreCLR/WebRequestPSCmdlet.CoreClr.cs:line 354
   at System.Management.Automation.Cmdlet.DoProcessRecord() in /home/nick/git/PowerShell/src/System.Management.Automation/engine/cmdlet.cs:line 177
   at System.Management.Automation.CommandProcessor.ProcessRecord() in /home/nick/git/PowerShell/src/System.Management.Automation/engine/CommandProcessor.cs:line 343

```

Environment data
----------------

<!-- provide the output of $PSVersionTable -->

```powershell
PS > $PSVersionTable                                                                                                   

Name                           Value                                                                                                           
----                           -----                                                                                                           
PSVersion                      6.0.0-alpha                                                                                                     
PSEdition                      Core                                                                                                            
PSCompatibleVersions           {1.0, 2.0, 3.0, 4.0...}                                                                                         
BuildVersion                   3.0.0.0                                                                                                         
GitCommitId                    v6.0.0-alpha.12-23-g211573db52a1d2f81ddb53a156306b298614689e                                                    
CLRVersion                                                                                                                                     
WSManStackVersion              3.0                                                                                                             
PSRemotingProtocolVersion      2.3                                                                                                             
SerializationVersion           1.1.0.1    

```

comments.author: nmbradford
comments.body: I've submitted a simple PR #2666 that handles the exception if content type is not found in the response header.  Feel free to point me in the right direction if this isn't the correct approach.

comments.author: PatrickLang
comments.body: @SteveL-MSFT is there any way to get this fixed in Nano Server?

comments.author: SteveL-MSFT
comments.body: @PatrickLang it is my understanding that future releases of Nano Server will pick up stable versions of PSCore 6.0+.  For now, if you need this, you can install PSCore 6.0 on Nano Server (xcopy is sufficient, but keep in mind it'll run side-by-side with the inbox PowerShell Core)

title: Linux Invoke-WebRequest throws exception when response contains no Content Type in the header.
